column4: I'm getting this error when I'm starting up vnc: http://paste-it.net/public/ga8e8f5/    How can I fix this error?
did u start it with sudo?
that made me go into the root user. I want to load it with my other user account.
then user need the permission to start vnc
i was able to start it before normally but after i did upgrade , update and few other minor things it started giving me these errors
try to take these users in the vnc group
/etc/group
there u will find the Groups
there are alot of commands to manage users. try to look for a list of basic commands linux
yea i was just looking that up now
especially look for "Users, Groups and Permissions"
what do i edit in the file specifically?
what do i edit in the file specifically?
try this https://help.ubuntu.com/community/VNC
That confused me a lot more =/
I opened up the file /etc/group, what do i have to edit there?
is there a group vnc?
no, should i make a group for vnc?
maybe u should install and configure vnc new using the help page
the thing is that it was working perfectly before i did upgrade and update, and svn up. I started it on my other user account by doing x11vnc -create.
thank you for the help
maybe u got corrupt packages. try sudo apt-get -f install
